Description: Sequential identifier for the sprint in which the task is planned or executed. Used for sorting and tracking over time.
Descriptive sprint title, usually including the sprint number and date range.
Start date of the sprint. Used for timeline filtering and scheduling.
End date of the sprint. Marks the closure of that sprint cycle.
Identifies the lab section, team, or program area where the request or task originated. Helps categorize and filter cross-functional work.
External ticket or issue ID from iTrack, Jira, or ServiceNow for traceability.
iTrack task ID used for quick reference within the tracker.
Primary team member responsible for the task’s completion.
Estimated hours required to complete the task. Used for planning and workload balancing.
Current progress state of the task. Recommended values: Planned, In Progress, Blocked, Completed, Deferred.
The team, individual, or system the task depends on before it can proceed.
Example / Notes: Enterprise IS – API setup; CoreLab - Build Testing;

Description: Main contact or lead responsible for resolving the dependency.
Indicates if the dependency has been secured or cleared. Suggested values: Yes, Pending, No, NA.
Free-text field for notes, blockers, updates, or discussion items captured during meetings. Add date when these comments are added.
Example / Notes:
2025-10-29: Got confirmation from CoreLab vendor confirmation; 
2025-10-30: Emailed but awaiting confirmation on participation from IS
